_header: God in glory of mights most
_description: The Sowdone of Babylone, a Charlemagne romance — 3274 lines mainly in quatrains

PULGar140.First Lines:
gOd in glorye of myghteste moostThat al thinge made in
                    SapienceBy vertue of woorde and holy goost…
PULGar140.Last Lines:
…And gyf vs ioye of the besteThat of here Gestes
                    rede
PULGar140.Note:
Oxford,  Bodleian Library Douce 175 (SC 21749) [olim Phillipps 8322]pp. 1-81, is a late seventeenth-century
                    transcript; ed. French  and  Hale (1930)
XWalter Hoyt French,   and  Charles Brockway Hale.  
             Middle English Metrical Romances.
         New York: Prentice-Hall, 1930, 239-84 (lines 1491-2118, 2175-3038,
                    3151-3225).
PULGar140.Attributed Title:
Here endithe the Romaunce of the Sowdoun of Babyloyne And of fferumbras his
                    sone who conquerede Rome And Kynge Charles off ffraunce with xii dosyn Peres
                    toke the Sowdon in the feelde And Smote of his heede (p. 81)
